learning_outcomes.description: Apply key frameworks for the management of risks relating to capital, funding, liquidity, credit, interest rates, currencies, commodities, and ESG.
Demonstrate how to manage these risks in collaboration with peers in a balance sheet context from the perspective of an issuer, intermediary/trader and funds manager.
Analyse commercially pragmatic attribution of performance splitting strategic and discretionary factors.
Explain the use of financial technologies in the digitalisation of some financial management processes.

Analyse public and private sector entities’ balance sheets with a view to recommend any opportunities to improve these entities’ financial risk management frameworks including rating agency engagement through storytelling.

assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Role play/ Simulation
assessments.task_description: This assessment consists of two parts. In the first part, students will discuss green bonds in detail, highlighting how they differ from conventional bonds, and provide a written report. In the second part, students will participate in a trading game applying insights from the online module and discussion in part one.This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT).
